bibliography.AU: Gopman, DB; Bedau, D; Mangin, S; Fullerton, EE; Katine, JA; Kent, AD
bibliography.AF: Gopman, D. B.; Bedau, D.; Mangin, S.; Fullerton, E. E.; Katine, J. A.; Kent, A. D.
bibliography.TI: Temperature dependent nucleation, propagation, and annihilation of domain walls in all-perpendicular spin-valve nanopillars
bibliography.DE: cobalt; magnetic domain walls; magnetic switching; magnetisation reversal; nanomagnetics; nanostructured materials; nickel; nucleation; spin valves
bibliography.ID: WAVE RESONANCE; ANISOTROPY; FLUCTUATIONS; JUNCTION; FIELD
bibliography.AB: We present a study of the temperature dependence of the switching fields in Co/Ni-based perpendicularly magnetized spin-valves. While magnetization reversal of all-perpendicular Co/Ni spin valves at ambient temperatures is typically marked by a single sharp step change in resistance, low temperature measurements can reveal a series of resistance steps, consistent with non-uniform magnetization configurations. We propose a model that consists of domain nucleation, propagation, and annihilation to explain the temperature dependence of the switching fields. Interestingly, low temperature (inf 30 K) step changes in resistance that we associate with domain nucleation have a bimodal switching field and resistance step distribution, attributable to two competing nucleation pathways.
